text: An erythroid specific enhancer upstream to the gene encoding the cell-type specific transcription factor <extra_id_0> GATA-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .
The transcription factor <extra_id_0> GATA-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> is expressed in a subset of hemopoietic cells , where it mediates the cell-type specific expression of several genes .
We have cloned the mouse and human GATA-1 genes .

A region upstream to the first exon , and highly conserved between mouse and man , acts as an erythroid specific enhancer in transient assays , if linked to the <extra_id_0> GATA-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> or to the SV40 promoter .
The activity of the enhancer is almost completely dependent on the integrity of a dimeric <extra_id_0> GATA-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> binding site .
